meanings.definition: The quality or state of being inanimate.
meanings.sent1: The inanimatenesses of the rock made it seem like it would never move.
meanings.sent2: The museum displayed various inanimatenesses such as ancient pottery and sculptures.
meanings.sent3: The inanimatenesses of the old car made it the perfect spot for a family of squirrels to build a nest.
meanings.sent4: The inanimatenesses of the abandoned house echoed with memories of the past.
meanings.sent5: The inanimatenesses of the painting seemed to come alive under the dim light.

meanings.definition: The lack of life or vitality in something.
meanings.sent1: The inanimatenesses of the desert landscape were both eerie and beautiful.
meanings.sent2: The empty streets at night had an unsettling inanimatenesses to them.
meanings.sent3: The inanimatenesses of the party was quickly lifted when the music started playing.
meanings.sent4: The inanimatenesses of the classroom was broken by the arrival of the energetic new teacher.
meanings.sent5: The inanimatenesses of the winter forest was interrupted by the sudden chirping of a hidden bird.
